prefercite.head: Preferred Citation

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This item was transferred on 26 October 1987.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The collection contains a manuscript fair copy of a poem, "Saint Francis endeth his sermon," and two letters to "Mr. Young" regretting her influence in England is not great enough to fulfill a request, thanking him for a letter and magazine, and declining to send a list of her published works, as she has none.

did.unittitle: Poem entitled "Saint Francis Endeth His Sermon." n.d.
Letter from Louise Imogen Guiney to "Dear Mr. Young" April 28 1901

scopecontent.p: Louise Imogen Guiney to "Dear Mr. Young." Informs Young that her influence in England is not great enough to fulfill his request.

did.unittitle: Louise Imogen Guiney to "Mr. Young" 26 October n.y.

scopecontent.p: Louise Imogen Guiney to "Dear Mr. Young." Thanks Young for his letter and a magazine, but declines to send him a complete list of her published works as she had not bothered to keep track of them all.
